intro: Denscantia andrei, commonly known as the Andean denscanthia, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its dense, clustered growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts interested in alpine flora.
